25:30- a joke
So much fun listening to Prof. Drennan...its simply incredible how she makes these complex biochemical reactions easily understandable.
Happy to here!
This course has introduced me to the joys of chemistry and persuaded me to apply for chemistry at university. Thank you professor Drennan, it has been a great journey.
thank you so much professor Catherine <3
Can we still reverse the climate change?

100 years later or more, 80% of the theory will be proven forgery. experiment, which can not be explained at that time, needs answers thus human imagination creates virtual world. if you actually test those theories by real experiment... you will know nothing makes sense. scientists usually perform brain-simulating results and effects... but if there is nothing to grasp on, demolish all the hypothesis and build a total new one.  if you add cellulose(dose not matter any kind) in the water and boil and simmer it, the shape inside the pot looks just like the hexagon shape. because while the water evaporates, hydrogen-bond(so called) makes tiny droplets all over the pot. and cellulose needs to be placed between the water droplets which makes hexagonal bond.(unit cell)  what if it is not water then? what if it is something that can be totally mixed in the water solution? then it will not make hexagonal shape.  silicon ingot has direction they said (110) (100) etc... is this because Si atom grows as unit cell grows?
A nice review. Nice lectures :)  Thank you, MIT OCW and Professor.
Thanks professor. Thanks mitocw:)
Thanks so much for this course! I did not expect to enjoy chemistry, but this class was very interesting and fun.
Thanks so much for sharing these videos, they are amazing. Thank you, Professor Catherine Drennan, you really did great teaching jobs.
Thanks Cathy, thanks MIT!
Thankful for the opportunity to watch this whole semester of classes at MIT!

Thank you so much for  showing how the fundamentals will be so helpful in solving the current issues in our system. The lectures are really very helpful for me.  Special Thanks to the lecturer. The way you teach is really inspiring mam.
MIT OCW and Cathy Drennan  what to say and how to thank you I just don't know... I want OCW to grow stronger and spread knowledge free  hence I am going to pay for OCW soon...

When I started this course, I was little bit intimidated by chemistry. After all those lectures, readings and exercises - I want more! :) Thank you very much for the opening of very interesting doors. I didn't know this chemical world well and now I am starting to understand so many things. Thank you.

What a journey until here! It's been awesome to be able to have acces to this classes. First, thank you MIT OpenCourseWare and second, Professor Catherine Drennan, you are an amazing teacher. People should know about you and be inspired by the way you teach.  Thank you for sharing such great and beautiful knowledge in such a beautiful way. Hope you  get to see this message one day !
Its been a fun ride!!! Thank you Professor Catherine Drennan. I really appreciate it :)
Thank you, Dr Catherine Drennan and MIT team for this excellent course. Maybe a couple of things to improve on, but I will have to think about what they are.   Thank you once again.
